page.title: 08Crops.
page.content: Ninety percent of our area (about 1010 Hectares) is made up of arable fields. We counted l3 different types of crop growing in the summer of l985. These were:_Grass, wheat, barley, wood potatoes, oil seed rape, sugar beet, peas, cabbage, lupins, strawberries, brussel sprouts and onions. Of these, grass and wheat account for more than 400 Hectares, whereas the last four crops totalled less than 4 Hectares. The peas are grown under contract to frozen food firms in Grimsby such as Birds_eye. All the sugar beet is taken for processing at the huge sugar factory at Bardney. Potatoes are bought and stored by local firms such as Ross at East Kirkby. One such firm uses several aircraft hangers on a disused wartime airfield for this purpose. However even these massive buildings have proved insufficient.
